div.p:
Join us on Thursday, April 23 to show appreciation for our health care workers and first responders who are on the frontlines battling the coronavirus to care for the sick.
We'd love to see social media flooded with pictures of people showing support by either wearing the color red or displaying a red ribbon or scarf on a pole or tree in their front yard. If you don't have a ribbon or scarf just use any red material you can find. There is no need to buy anything.
Use the hashtag #YJNationInThisTogether, and we'll share your posts! View Image

SSD Families: We are extending the due date to submit AMI Packets (Days 2 - 10). Please mail, email, or place in the drop boxes by 3 p.m. on Monday, April 20. The drop boxes are located at the front entrance of each campus, from 8 AM - 3 PM.

In adherence to Governor Asa Hutchinson's directive, the Sheridan School District will remain closed for online instruction through the end of the school year to limit the spread of COVID-19 in Arkansas. We will continue to provide instruction through our digital learning plan. Click on the following link for information about our digital learning plan: https://bit.ly/2RgdPvI.

Note: Pre-K Registration and Kindergarten Registration have been postponed. We will announce new dates soon. All Sheridan School District playgrounds are closed to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in our community.
